patient_age_quote: A 61-year-old female with a history of ductal hyperplasia of the breast
patient_sex_quote: A 61-year-old female with a history of ductal hyperplasia of the breast
comorbidities: ['ductal hyperplasia of the breast', 'common variable immunodeficiency syndrome (CVID)', 'asthma', 'obstructive sleep apnea', 'thyroid follicular cancer']
comorbidities_quote: A 61-year-old female with a history of ductal hyperplasia of the breast, common variable immunode /uniFB01 ciency syndrome (CVID), asthma, obstructive sleep apnea, and thyroid follicular cancer
follow_up_ct_findings: ['numerous sub 6 mm bilateral centrilobular GGNs', 'solid pulmonary nodules with mild upper lobe predominance']
follow_up_ct_findings_quote: a follow-up CT scan chest 1 year later showed numerous sub 6 mm bilateral centrilobular GGNs and solid pulmonary nodules with mild upper lobe predominance
lab_results: ['chronic neutropenia with lymphocytosis', 'positive perinuclear and cytoplasmic antineutrophil cytoplasmic (PANCA & CANCA) antibody', 'negative antinuclear (ANA)', 'negative myeloperoxidase (MPO)', 'negative proteinase 3 (PR3)']
lab_results_quote: Labs demonstrated chronic neutropenia with lymphocytosis, positive perinuclear and cytoplasmic antineutrophil cytoplasmic (PANCA & CANCA) antibody, but negative antinuclear (ANA), myeloperoxidase (MPO), and proteinase 3 (PR3).
diagnostic_methods: ['CT angiogram chest', 'follow-up CT scan', 'thyroid radioactive iodine uptake scan', 'bronchoscopy with bronchioalveolar lavage (BAL)', 'transbronchial cryo biopsy', 'immunostaining']
diagnostic_methods_quote: diagnosed with diffuse pulmonary nodules incidentally via CT angiogram chest... A thyroid radioactive iodine uptake scan... The patient eventually underwent bronchoscopy with bronchioalveolar lavage (BAL) with transbronchial cryo biopsy of lung nodules
case_discussion: Given the complexity of the case, lack of symptoms, and stability of nodules, a decision was made for close follow-up with serial CT scans
case_discussion_quote: The patient's case was discussed with a multidisciplinary ILD clinic, and given the complexity of the case, lack of symptoms, and stability of nodules, a decision was made for close follow-up with serial CT scans.
differential_diagnosis: ['malignant nodules', 'atypical infection', 'autoimmune interstitial lung disease (ILD)', 'granulomatous lymphocytic interstitial lung disease (GLI-ILD)']
differential_diagnosis_quote: Differentials at the time of diagnosis included malignant nodules, atypical infection, autoimmune interstitial lung disease (ILD), and granulomatous lymphocytic interstitial lung disease (GLI-ILD).
diagnostic_procedure_final_quote: transbronchial cryo biopsy of lung nodules, which showed MPMNs with further immunostaining negative for malignancy
final_diagnosis_quote: In our case, the patient was diagnosed with DPM, which is an exceptionally rare form of widespread MPMs with few cases reported in the literature.
disease_stability_quote: given the complexity of the case, lack of symptoms, and stability of nodules

patient_age_quote: A 63-year-old woman was referred for dedicated chest CT imaging
patient_sex_quote: A 63-year-old woman was referred for dedicated chest CT imaging
symptoms_quote: abdominal CT scan performed for evaluation of diarrhea
diagnostic_methods_quote: Chest CT showed numerous small ( , 6 mm), rounded, ground-glass, randomly distributed nodules... Right lower lobe transbronchial cryobiopsy histopathologic findings revealed nodular cellular proliferation... Immunohistochemistry with positive staining
immunostaining_results: ["positive staining for epithelial membrane antigen and progesterone receptor", "negative staining for neuroendocrine markers such as synaptophysin"]

case_discussion: ["MPMNs are characterized by meningothelial-like cellular proliferation within the lung interstitium", "Women are more frequently affected during the 6th or 7th decade of life", "MPMNs usually follow a benign, indolent course", "Tissue sampling is required to establish definitive diagnosis"]
case_discussion_quote: Minute pulmonary meningothelial-like nodules (MPMNs) are characterized by meningothelial-like cellular proliferation within the lung interstitium. Women are more frequently affected during the 6th or 7th decade of life... MPMNs usually follow a benign, indolent course... Tissue sampling is required to establish definitive diagnosis
differential_diagnosis: ['adenocarcinoma in situ', 'carcinoid tumor and tumorlets', 'nonfibrotic hypersensitivity pneumonitis', 'vasculitis', 'atypical infection']
differential_diagnosis_quote: MPMNs usually follow a benign, indolent course but may mimic adenocarcinoma in situ, carcinoid tumor and tumorlets, nonfibrotic hypersensitivity pneumonitis, vasculitis, or atypical infection

diagnostic_procedure_final_quote: Right lower lobe transbronchial cryobiopsy histopathologic findings revealed nodular cellular proliferation

patient_age_quote: A 48-year-old non-smoking woman presented with an abnormal shadow on chest radiography during routine health screening.
patient_sex_quote: A 48-year-old non-smoking woman presented with an abnormal shadow on chest radiography during routine health screening.
comorbidities_quote: The patient had a history of Turner syndrome and had been receiving hormone supplementation with estrogen and progesterone since childhood.
symptoms_quote: Although the patient had few symptoms, she visited a local hospital because of the results of the routine health screening.
follow_up_ct_findings: ['No further disease progression was observed over a follow-up period of seven months without treatment']
follow_up_ct_findings_quote: No further disease progression was observed over a follow-up period of seven months without treatment.
diagnostic_methods_quote: Chest CT revealed diffuse centrilobular granular opacities and nodular shadows in both lungs... Bronchoscopy revealed a mildly elevated lymphocyte fraction of 21 % in the bronchoalveolar lavage fluid (BALF)... Subsequently, TBLC was performed using a 1.9 mm cryoprobe
immunostaining_results: ["positive for epithelial membrane antigen (EMA)", "positive for progesterone receptor (PgR)", "positive for CD56"]
immunostaining_results_quote: Immunohistochemically, these cells were positive for the epithelial membrane antigen (EMA), progesterone receptor (PgR), and CD 56
case_discussion: This case highlights the diagnostic utility of TBLC for the evaluation of small pulmonary nodules that exhibit the Cheerios sign.
case_discussion_quote: This case highlights the diagnostic utility of TBLC for the evaluation of small pulmonary nodules that exhibit the Cheerios sign.
differential_diagnosis: ['pulmonary Langerhans cell histiocytosis', 'DPM', 'granulomatosis with polyangiitis', 'metastatic lung tumors', 'infectious diseases', 'fungal infections', 'mycobacterial infections']
differential_diagnosis_quote: Based on the characteristic CT findings of nodules with central cavitation, known as the Cheerios sign, differential diagnoses including pulmonary Langerhans cell histiocytosis, DPM, granulomatosis with polyangiitis, metastatic lung tumors, and infectious diseases, such as fungal or mycobacterial infections, were considered.
imaging_findings: ["diffuse centrilobular granular opacities and nodular shadows in both lungs", "some nodular shadows accompanied by central cavities"]
imaging_findings_quote: Chest CT revealed diffuse centrilobular granular opacities and nodular shadows in both lungs, with some nodular shadows accompanied by central cavities
pathology_findings: ["multiple small nodules measuring approximately 2 mm in diameter in the interstitium", "nodules consisted of low-grade, round to short spindle-shaped cells resembling meningeal epithelial cells", "uniform round nuclei and eosinophilic cytoplasm", "no cellular atypia, necrosis, or significant inflammation"]
pathology_findings_quote: Histopathological examinations of both specimens revealed multiple small nodules measuring approximately 2 mm in diameter in the interstitium... The nodules consisted of low-grade, round to short spindle-shaped cells resembling meningeal epithelial cells, with uniform round nuclei and eosinophilic cytoplasm. No cellular atypia, necrosis, or significant inflammation was observed.
treatment_interventions_quote: Given the potential hormonal influence on both the DPM and uterine polyps, estrogen and progesterone supplementation was discontinued
outcome_response: ["remained asymptomatic", "no significant issues related to Turner syndrome", "pulmonary function did not decline", "clinical and radiological findings remained stable"]
outcome_response_quote: After discontinuation, the patient remained asymptomatic, with no significant issues related to Turner syndrome. Furthermore, the patient's pulmonary function did not decline, and both the clinical and radiological findings remained stable during the seven-month follow-up period without treatment.
diagnostic_procedure_initial_quote: Although the TBLB sample included alveolar areas, the target lesion could not be captured; therefore, a definitive diagnosis could not be established.
diagnostic_procedure_final_quote: Subsequently, TBLC was performed using a 1.9 mm cryoprobe with a 6second freezing time and the blood-blocking balloon technique.
final_diagnosis_quote: the patient was diagnosed with DPM based on the radiological and histopathological findings.
hormone_therapy_discontinued_quote: estrogen and progesterone supplementation was discontinued, with the expectation that hormone withdrawal might halt disease progression.
disease_stability: ["remained stable during the seven-month follow-up period without treatment"]
disease_stability_quote: both the clinical and radiological findings remained stable during the seven-month follow-up period without treatment.
diagnostic_marker_positive_quote: Immunohistochemically, these cells were positive for the epithelial membrane antigen (EMA), progesterone receptor (PgR), and CD 56
filename: Hirakawa et al. - 2025 - Diffuse Pulmonary Meningotheliomatosis Presenting with the Cheerios Sign Diagnosed by a Transbronchi.pdf
extraction_notes: All key information was clearly stated in the text with direct quotes available. The case report format made extraction straightforward.

comorbidities_quote: with a past medical history of transient ischemic attack, hypertension, and childhood asthma on albuterol
symptoms_quote: presented to the clinic for worsening dyspnea since December 2019. Her dyspnea originally started with cold symptoms including a cough; although her cough improved, her dyspnea persisted.
lab_results: ['Fungal serology negative', 'connective tissue disease panels negative', 'Quantiferon testing negative', 'Cultures negative for bacterial, mycobacterial and fungal growth']
lab_results_quote: Fungal serology and connective tissue disease panels were negative. Quantiferon testing was negative. Cultures were negative for bacterial, mycobacterial and fungal growth.
diagnostic_methods: ['CT of the chest', 'bronchoscopy with bronchoalveolar lavage (BAL)', 'transbronchial lung biopsies (TBBX)', 'right thoracotomy with multiple lung biopsies', 'immunostaining']
diagnostic_methods_quote: A CT of the chest was obtained... She subsequently underwent a bronchoscopy with bronchoalveolar lavage (BAL) and transbronchial lung biopsies (TBBX)... she underwent a right thoracotomy with multiple lung biopsies.
immunostaining_results: positive for epithelial membrane antigen (EMA), CD56, and progesterone receptor
immunostaining_results_quote: immunostaining positive for epithelial membrane antigen (EMA), CD56, and progesterone receptor
case_discussion: Diffuse pulmonary meningotheliomatosis is a rare diagnosis with unclear etiology. The case highlights the importance of considering this condition in patients with dyspnea and multiple pulmonary nodules.
case_discussion_quote: Diffuse pulmonary meningotheliomatosis is a rare diagnosis, and the etiology is still unclear, with the leading theory being that it originates from meningothelial cells... This case illustrates the need for consideration of diffuse pulmonary meningotheliomatosis in the differential diagnosis for patients who present with dyspnea and are found to have multiple pulmonary nodules on imaging.
imaging_findings: diffuse subcentimetric nodularities in random distribution
imaging_findings_quote: A CT of the chest was obtained, which showed diffuse subcentimetric nodularities in random distribution.
pathology_findings: nested cells with meningothelial like morphology
pathology_findings_quote: Nested cells with meningothelial like morphology (A+B)
pulmonary_nodules_description: diffuse subcentimetric nodularities in random distribution
pulmonary_nodules_description_quote: diffuse subcentimetric nodularities in random distribution
diagnostic_procedure_initial_quote: She subsequently underwent a bronchoscopy with bronchoalveolar lavage (BAL) and transbronchial lung biopsies (TBBX).
diagnostic_procedure_final: right thoracotomy with multiple lung biopsies
diagnostic_procedure_final_quote: she underwent a right thoracotomy with multiple lung biopsies. Pathology was significant for nested cells with immunostaining positive for epithelial membrane antigen (EMA), CD56, and progesterone receptor.
final_diagnosis_quote: The morphology and immunophenotype supported the diagnosis of diffuse pulmonary meningotheliomatosis.
diagnostic_marker_positive_quote: immunostaining positive for epithelial membrane antigen (EMA), CD56, and progesterone receptor
filename: Saa and Assaf - 2022 - A Rare Case of Pulmonary Nodules Diffuse Pulmonary Meningotheliomatosis.pdf
